page.title: 04ATTENBOROUGH. Railways.
page.content: Lots of different types of Railway Engines use the line which passes through Attenborough. To the east, the line goes to Beeston and Nottingham, to the west, Long Eaton, Spondon and Derby, to the south, to Loughborough and to the north, Toton Sidings. The different types of railway engines that use the line include the classes 20,25,31,with an odd 37,45,47 and 58.There are also Inter-City 125's that use the line to London and DMU's to Nottingham,Beeston,Long Eaton, Spondon and Derby. The freight that uses the line is mainly coal;from the coal mines in Nottinghamshire to power stations along the Trent Valley.Other goods carried include Oil,Newspapers,Ballast and Mixed Freight in containers based at the Freightliner terminal at Beeston. T.D.Franks.
